00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File:   block_sparse_array.c
00050  *      Author: Robert Kidd and Wen-mei Hwu
00051  *      This file contains definitions for routines to manage the Pcode
00052  *      symbol table.
00053  *
00054  *      The sparse array is implemented as a doubly linked list of
00055  *      blocks that are multiples of BLOCK_SIZE (defined in sparse_array.h)
00056  *      elements long.  It is indended to efficiently store small clusters
00057  *      of data at widely separated indices.
00058  *
00059  *      Block size is variable, but must be a multiple of BLOCK_SIZE.  As
00060  *      the array grows, adjacent blocks are merged to keep the length of
00061  *      the list down.
00062  *
00063 \*****************************************************************************/
00064 
00065 #include <config.h>
00066 #include <stdlib.h>
00067 #include <malloc.h>
00068 #include <string.h>
00069 #include <stdio.h>
00070 #include <library/i_error.h>
00071 #include "block_sparse_array.h"
00072 
00073 static void AllocateData (BlockSparseArray block, int index, int length);
00074 static BlockSparseArray ExtractBlock (BlockSparseArray block, int index,
00075                                       int length);
00076 static void MergeBlocks (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, int length);
00077 static int GetBlock (BlockSparseArray *array, int index);
00078 static void GetOrAddBlock (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, int length);
00079 
00080 BlockSparseArray
00081 NewBlockSparseArray ()
00082 {
00083   BlockSparseArray new;
00084 
00085   new = malloc (sizeof (_BlockSparseArray));
00086 
00087   if (new == NULL)
00088     I_punt ("block_sparse_array.c:NewBlockSparseArray:%d Could not allocate BlockSparseArray", __LINE__);
00089 
00090   memset (new, 0, sizeof (_BlockSparseArray));
00091 
00092   return (new);
00093 }
00094 
00095 void
00096 FreeBlockSparseArray (BlockSparseArray array)
00097 {
00098   int i;
00099 
00100   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00101   while (array->prev)
00102     array = array->prev;
00103 
00104   if (array->data != NULL)
00105     {
00106       if (array->options & BSA_CHECK_NULL_ON_FREE)
00107         for (i = 0; i < array->length; i++)
00108           if (array->data[i] != NULL)
00109             I_warn ("block_sparse_array.c:FreeBlockSparseArray:%d\n"
00110                     "data[%d] (array[%d]) is non-null", __LINE__, i,
00111                     array->first_index + i);
00112 
00113       free (array->data);
00114       array->data = NULL;
00115     }
00116 
00117   if (array->next)
00118     {
00119       array->next->prev = NULL;
00120 
00121       FreeBlockSparseArray (array->next);
00122 
00123       array->next = NULL;
00124     }
00125 
00126   free (array);
00127 }
00128 
00129 /* Insert a new element into the array.  This function updates the array
00130  * pointer to point to the block containing the inserted element. */
00131 void
00132 BlockSparseArraySet (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, void *data)
00133 {
00134   if (array == NULL)
00135     I_punt ("block_sparse_array.c:BlockSparseArraySet:%d array is NULL",
00136             __LINE__);
00137 
00138   GetOrAddBlock (array, index, 1);
00139 
00140   /* Insert the element into the array. */
00141   if (((*array)->options & BSA_WARN_ON_OVERWRITE) && \
00142       (*array)->data[index - (*array)->first_index] != NULL)
00143     I_warn ("block_sparse_array.c:BlockSparseArraySet:%d\n"
00144             "overwriting non-null value at index %d (block %d, index %d)",
00145             __LINE__, index, (*array)->first_index,
00146             index - (*array)->first_index);
00147 
00148   (*array)->data[index - (*array)->first_index] = data;
00149 
00150   return;
00151 }
00152 
00153 /* Sets an array element to null.  Does not warn if a non-null entry is
00154  * being overwritten. */
00155 void
00156 BlockSparseArrayClear (BlockSparseArray *array, int index)
00157 {
00158   if (array == NULL)
00159     I_punt ("block_sparse_array.c:BlockSparseArrayClear:%d array is NULL",
00160             __LINE__);
00161 
00162   GetOrAddBlock (array, index, 1);
00163 
00164   (*array)->data[index - (*array)->first_index] = NULL;
00165 
00166   return;
00167 }
00168 
00169 /* Get an element from the array.  This function updates the array pointer
00170  * to point to the block containing the accessed element. */
00171 void *
00172 BlockSparseArrayGet (BlockSparseArray *array, int index)
00173 {
00174   /* Find the block that should contain the index. */
00175   if (GetBlock (array, index) == 0)
00176     return (NULL);
00177   else
00178     return ((*array)->data[index - (*array)->first_index]);
00179 }
00180 
00181 /* Returns the index of the first element in the array.  Returns -1 if there
00182  * are no elements.  This function updates the array pointer to point to the
00183  * block containing the first element. */
00184 int
00185 BlockSparseArrayGetFirstIndex (BlockSparseArray *array)
00186 {
00187   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00188   while ((*array)->prev)
00189     (*array) = (*array)->prev;
00190 
00191   if ((*array)->length == 0)
00192     return (-1);
00193   else
00194     return ((*array)->first_index);
00195 }
00196 
00197 /* Returns the index of the next element after the given index.  Returns -1
00198  * if the given index is the last element.  This function updates the array
00199  * pointer to point to the block containing the returned index. */
00200 int
00201 BlockSparseArrayGetNextIndex (BlockSparseArray *array, int index)
00202 {
00203   /* Find the block containing the given index. */
00204   if (GetBlock (array, index) == 0)
00205     {
00206       /* End of array */
00207       return (-1);
00208     }
00209   else
00210     {
00211       /* If this is the last index in this block, return the first index
00212        * in the next block. */
00213       if ((*array)->first_index + (*array)->length == index + 1)
00214         {
00215           if ((*array)->next)
00216             {
00217               (*array) = (*array)->next;
00218               return ((*array)->first_index);
00219             }
00220           else
00221             {
00222               return (-1);
00223             }
00224         }
00225       else
00226         {
00227           return (index + 1);
00228         }
00229     }
00230 }
00231 
00232 /* Returns the index of the first non-zero element in the array.  Returns -1
00233  * if there is no non-zero element.  This function updates the array pointer
00234  * to point to the block containing the first non-zero element. */
00235 int
00236 BlockSparseArrayGetFirstNonZeroIndex (BlockSparseArray *array)
00237 {
00238   int i;
00239   BlockSparseArray temp = *array;
00240 
00241   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00242   while (temp->prev)
00243     temp = temp->prev;
00244 
00245   while (temp)
00246     {
00247       for (i = 0; i < temp->length; i++)
00248         if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00249           {
00250             *array = temp;
00251             return (temp->first_index + i);
00252           }
00253 
00254       temp = temp->next;
00255     }
00256 
00257   return (-1);
00258 }
00259 
00260 /* Returns the index of the next non-zero element after the given index.
00261  * Returns -1 if the given index is the last non-zero.  This function updates
00262  * the array pointer to point to the block containing the returned element. */
00263 int
00264 BlockSparseArrayGetNextNonZeroIndex (BlockSparseArray *array, int index)
00265 {
00266   int i;
00267   BlockSparseArray temp;
00268 
00269   /* Find the block containing the given index. */
00270   if (GetBlock (array, index) == 0)
00271     {
00272       /* End of array */
00273       return (-1);
00274     }
00275   else
00276     {
00277       temp = *array;
00278 
00279       /* Search the rest of the current block for a non-zero. */
00280       for (i = index - temp->first_index; i < temp->length; i++)
00281         if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00282           {
00283             *array = temp;
00284             return (temp->first_index + i);
00285           }
00286 
00287       /* Search the rest of the array for a non-zero. */
00288       temp = temp->next;
00289 
00290       while (temp)
00291         {
00292           for (i = 0; i < temp->length; i++)
00293             if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00294               {
00295                 *array = temp;
00296                 return (temp->first_index + i);
00297               }
00298 
00299           temp = temp->next;
00300         }
00301     }
00302 
00303   return (-1);
00304 }
00305 
00306 /* Returns the first non-zero element in the array.  Updates the index argument
00307  * to be the index of this element.  Returns NULL (and sets index to -1) if
00308  * there are no non-zero elements.  This function updates the array pointer
00309  * to point to the block containing the returned element. */
00310 void *
00311 BlockSparseArrayGetFirstNonZero (BlockSparseArray *array, int *index)
00312 {
00313   int i;
00314   BlockSparseArray temp = *array;
00315 
00316   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00317   while (temp->prev)
00318     temp = temp->prev;
00319 
00320   while (temp)
00321     {
00322       for (i = 0; i < temp->length; i++)
00323         if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00324           {
00325             *array = temp;
00326             *index = temp->first_index + i;
00327             return (temp->data[i]);
00328           }
00329 
00330       temp = temp->next;
00331     }
00332 
00333   *index = -1;
00334   return (NULL);
00335 }
00336 
00337 /* Returns the next non-zero element after the given index.  Updates the
00338  * index argument to be the index of this element.  Returns NULL (and sets
00339  * index to -1) if there are no more non-zero elements.  This function updates
00340  * the array pointer to point to the block containing the returned element. */
00341 void *
00342 BlockSparseArrayGetNextNonZero (BlockSparseArray *array, int *index)
00343 {
00344   int i;
00345   BlockSparseArray temp;
00346 
00347   /* Find the block containing the given index. */
00348   if (GetBlock (array, *index) == 0)
00349     {
00350       /* End of array */
00351       *index = -1;
00352       return (NULL);
00353     }
00354   else
00355     {
00356       temp = *array;
00357 
00358       /* Search the rest of the current block for a non-zero. */
00359       for (i = (*index - temp->first_index) + 1; i < temp->length; i++)
00360         if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00361           {
00362             *array = temp;
00363             *index = temp->first_index + i;
00364             return (temp->data[i]);
00365           }
00366 
00367       /* Search the rest of the array for a non-zero. */
00368       temp = temp->next;
00369 
00370       while (temp)
00371         {
00372           for (i = 0; i < temp->length; i++)
00373             if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00374               {
00375                 *array = temp;
00376                 *index = temp->first_index + i;
00377                 return (temp->data[i]);
00378               }
00379 
00380           temp = temp->next;
00381         }
00382     }
00383 
00384   *index = -1;
00385   return (NULL);
00386 }
00387 
00388 void
00389 BlockSparseArraySetOption (BlockSparseArray array, int option)
00390 {
00391   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00392   while (array->prev)
00393     array = array->prev;
00394 
00395   while (array)
00396     {
00397       array->options |= option;
00398       array = array->next;
00399     }
00400 }
00401 
00402 void
00403 BlockSparseArrayClrOption (BlockSparseArray array, int option)
00404 {
00405   /* Find the first block in the list. */
00406   while (array->prev)
00407     array = array->prev;
00408 
00409   while (array)
00410     {
00411       array->options &= ~option;
00412       array = array->next;
00413     }
00414 }
00415 
00416 /* Prepare the array for several set operations.  This will pre-allocate
00417  * a block for the needed indices.  Calling this function before a series
00418  * of sets to closely spaced indices will improve efficiency.  This function
00419  * updates the array pointer to point to the prepared block. */
00420 void
00421 BlockSparseArrayPrepare (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, int length)
00422 {
00423   GetOrAddBlock (array, index, length);
00424 
00425   return;
00426 }
00427 
00428 /* Removes blocks that contain all zeros from the array.  This function
00429  * returns a pointer to the first block in the list. */
00430 void
00431 BlockSparseArrayCompact (BlockSparseArray *array)
00432 {
00433   BlockSparseArray temp = *array;
00434   BlockSparseArray tail = NULL;
00435   BlockSparseArray new, next;
00436   int i;
00437   int index = 0, length = 0;
00438   int index_found;
00439   int free_node;
00440   
00441   while (temp)
00442     {
00443       next = temp->next;
00444 
00445       index_found = 0;
00446       free_node = 0;
00447 
00448       /* Walk through the list node to discover blocks of non-zeros. */
00449       for (i = 0; i < temp->length; i++)
00450         {
00451           if (temp->data[i] != NULL)
00452             {
00453               if (index_found == 0)
00454                 {
00455                   /* This is the first non-zero in a block.  Set index
00456                    * to the closest block boundary and set length
00457                    * to one block. */
00458                   index = BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (temp->first_index + i);
00459                   length = BLOCK_SIZE;
00460                   index_found = 1;
00461                 }
00462               else
00463                 {
00464                   /* Three possibilities:
00465                    * (Note: block refers to the one we're discovering inside
00466                    *  the list node, not the list node itself)
00467                    * 1. The next non-zero is in the known block (index, length)
00468                    *    as the last.
00469                    *   -Do nothing.
00470                    * 2. The next non-zero is in the next block (the one
00471                    *    starting at index+length).
00472                    *   -Add the next block (of length BLOCK_SIZE) to the known
00473                    *    block.
00474                    * 3. The next non-zero is at least one block after the known
00475                    *    block.
00476                    *   -Create a new block from the known block, reset index
00477                    *    and length, continue scanning for non-zeros. */
00478                   if (index + length <= temp->first_index + i)
00479                     {
00480                       if (index + length + BLOCK_SIZE > temp->first_index + i)
00481                         {
00482                           /* non-zero is in the next block. */
00483                           length += BLOCK_SIZE;
00484                         }
00485                       else
00486                         {
00487                           new = ExtractBlock (temp, index, length);
00488 
00489                           if (tail)
00490                             {
00491                               tail->next = new;
00492                               new->prev = tail;
00493                             }
00494                           else
00495                             {
00496                               *array = new;
00497                             }
00498                           tail = new;
00499 
00500                           /* If ExtractBlock allocated a new node, we can
00501                            * free temp when we're done. */
00502                           if (new != temp)
00503                             free_node = 1;
00504 
00505                           /* Start a new block at the current non-zero. */
00506                           index = BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (temp->first_index + i);
00507                           length = BLOCK_SIZE;
00508                           index_found = 1;
00509                         }
00510                     }
00511                 }
00512             }
00513         }
00514       
00515       /* Copy the last data from the block. */
00516       if (index_found == 1)
00517         {
00518           new = ExtractBlock (temp, index, length);
00519 
00520           if (tail)
00521             {
00522               tail->next = new;
00523               new->prev = tail;
00524             }
00525           else
00526             {
00527               *array = new;
00528             }
00529           tail = new;
00530 
00531           if (new != temp)
00532             free_node = 1;
00533         }
00534 
00535       /* Free the node if we copied part of it inside the for loop or there
00536        * were no non-zero elements found. */
00537       if (free_node || index_found == 0)
00538         {
00539           temp->prev = NULL;
00540           temp->next = NULL;
00541           BlockSparseArrayClrOption (temp, BSA_CHECK_NULL_ON_FREE);
00542           FreeBlockSparseArray (temp);
00543         }
00544 
00545       temp = next;
00546     }
00547 
00548   return;
00549 }
00550 
00551 void
00552 BlockSparseArrayDump (BlockSparseArray array, FILE *out,
00553                       void (*print_func)(FILE *out, void *data))
00554 {
00555   int i, j;
00556 
00557   if (array)
00558     {
00559       /* Find the first block in the list. */
00560       while (array->prev)
00561         array = array->prev;
00562       
00563       for (i = 0; array; i++, array = array->next)
00564         {
00565 #if 0
00566           printf ("Block %d, first_index %d, length %d\n", i,
00567                   array->first_index, array->length);
00568 #endif
00569           for (j = 0; j < array->length; j++)
00570             {
00571 #if 0
00572               printf ("Array element %d (block element %d) = ",
00573                       array->first_index + j, j);
00574 #endif
00575               
00576               print_func (out, array->data[j]);
00577               
00578 #if 0
00579               printf ("\n");
00580 #endif
00581             }
00582         }
00583     }
00584   else
00585     {
00586 #if 0
00587       printf ("array is null\n");
00588 #endif
00589     }
00590 }
00591 
00592 /* Allocates space for a new block of elements.  Sets the data, first_index,
00593  * and length fields in the BlockSparseArray structure.  The block allocated
00594  * by this function will be a multiple of BLOCK_SIZE in length and start
00595  * at an index which is a multiple of BLOCK_SIZE. */
00596 static void
00597 AllocateData (BlockSparseArray block, int index, int length)
00598 {
00599   block->first_index = BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (index);
00600   block->length = BSA_BLOCK_LENGTH (index, length);
00601   block->data = malloc (sizeof (void *) * block->length);
00602   if (block->data == NULL)
00603     I_punt ("block_sparse_array.c:AllocateData:%d Could not allocate memory",
00604             __LINE__);
00605 
00606   memset (block->data, 0, sizeof (void *) * block->length);
00607 }
00608 
00609 /* Extracts elements from block starting at index with the given length.
00610  * If index and length match those of the block, block is returned.
00611  * Otherwise, a new block is allocated and filled with data copied
00612  * from block.
00613  * Note: The data copied from block is exactly from index (inclusive) to
00614  * index + length (exclusive).  The actual block allocated may be padded
00615  * at the beginning or end. */
00616 static BlockSparseArray
00617 ExtractBlock (BlockSparseArray block, int index, int length)
00618 {
00619   BlockSparseArray new;
00620 
00621   if (index == block->first_index && length == block->length)
00622     {
00623       new = block;
00624     }
00625   else
00626     {
00627       new = NewBlockSparseArray ();
00628       new->options = block->options;
00629       AllocateData (new, index, length);
00630       memcpy (&(new->data[index - new->first_index]),
00631               &(block->data[index - block->first_index]),
00632               length * sizeof (void *));
00633     }
00634 
00635   return (new);
00636 }
00637 
00638 /* Merges several blocks into a single large block.  Any elements between
00639  * index and (index + length - 1), plus those needed to pad index and
00640  * length to block boundaries, are merged.  The smaller blocks are freed
00641  * and the array list repaired.  This function updates the array pointer to
00642  * point to the newly allocated block. */
00643 static void
00644 MergeBlocks (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, int length)
00645 {
00646   BlockSparseArray first = NULL;
00647   BlockSparseArray temp = NULL, last = NULL, new = NULL;
00648   int new_index = 0, new_length = 0;
00649   int last_index = 0, last_length = 0;
00650 
00651   /* Find the block where the first element should be found. */
00652   if (GetBlock (array, index) == 0)
00653     {
00654       /* If the first block in the merge set doesn't exist yet, find
00655        * the first block that does exist. */
00656       if (GetBlock (array, index + BLOCK_SIZE) == 0)
00657         return;
00658     }      
00659 
00660   first = *array;
00661 
00662   /* first is the first block in the merge set.  Find the last block in the
00663    * set. */
00664   last_index = first->first_index;
00665   last_length = first->length;
00666   last = first->next;
00667 
00668   while (last && (last->first_index < index + length))
00669     {
00670       last_index = last->first_index;
00671       last_length = last->length;
00672       last = last->next;
00673     }
00674 
00675   /* Note that last is the first block after the merge set, but last_index
00676    * and last_length are the index and length of the last block in the
00677    * merge set (ie, last->prev).  This lets us get the last index and length
00678    * even if last is NULL. */
00679 
00680   new_index = index;
00681   new_length = length;
00682 
00683   /* The first block may extend before the merge range, so adjust the
00684    * range to include the entire first block. */
00685   if (first->first_index <= index)
00686     {
00687       new_index = first->first_index;
00688       new_length = length + (index - new_index);
00689     }
00690 
00691   /* The last block may extend past the merge range, so adjust the range
00692    * to include the entire last block. */
00693   if (last_index + last_length > index + length)
00694     {
00695       new_length += (last_index + last_length) - (index + length);
00696     }
00697 
00698   new = NewBlockSparseArray ();
00699   if (*array)
00700     new->options = (*array)->options;
00701   AllocateData (new, new_index, new_length);
00702 
00703   /* Copy data from blocks in the merge range. */
00704   if (first)
00705     {
00706       new->prev = first->prev;
00707       new->next = last;
00708 
00709       temp = first;
00710       while (temp != last)
00711         {
00712           BlockSparseArray next = temp->next;
00713 
00714           memcpy (&(new->data[temp->first_index - new->first_index]),
00715                   temp->data, temp->length * sizeof (void *));
00716 
00717           temp->prev = NULL;
00718           temp->next = NULL;
00719           BlockSparseArrayClrOption (temp, BSA_CHECK_NULL_ON_FREE);
00720           FreeBlockSparseArray (temp);
00721 
00722           temp = next;
00723         }
00724 
00725       if (new->next)
00726         new->next->prev = new;
00727       if (new->prev)
00728         new->prev->next = new;
00729     }
00730 
00731   *array = new;
00732   return;
00733 }
00734 
00735 /* Updates array to point to the block where the given index should
00736  * be found.  Function returns 1 if the block was found and 0 if the
00737  * block doesn't exist. */
00738 static int
00739 GetBlock (BlockSparseArray *array, int index)
00740 {
00741   BlockSparseArray temp = *array;
00742 
00743   /* If the index is in the current block (array), simply return array.
00744    * Otherwise, find the block and return a pointer. */
00745   if (temp->first_index > index || \
00746       temp->first_index + temp->length <= index)
00747     {
00748       if (temp->first_index + temp->length <= index)
00749         {
00750           while ((temp->first_index + temp->length <= index) && temp->next)
00751             temp = temp->next;
00752           
00753           if (temp->first_index > index || \
00754               ((temp->first_index + temp->length <= index) && \
00755                temp->next == NULL))
00756             return (0);
00757         }
00758       else
00759         {
00760           while (temp->prev && \
00761                  (temp->prev->first_index + temp->prev->length > index))
00762             temp = temp->prev;
00763           
00764           if ((temp->first_index > index && \
00765                (temp->prev == NULL || \
00766                 temp->prev->first_index + temp->prev->length <= index)) || \
00767               (temp->first_index + temp->length <= index))
00768             return (0);
00769         }
00770     }
00771 
00772   *array = temp;
00773   return (1);
00774 }
00775 
00776 /* Updates array to point to the block where the given index should
00777  * be found.  Adds a new block with enough room for length elements
00778  * if needed. */
00779 static void
00780 GetOrAddBlock (BlockSparseArray *array, int index, int length)
00781 {
00782   BlockSparseArray temp;
00783   BlockSparseArray next = NULL, prev = NULL, new = NULL;
00784   int initialize_struct_only = 0, merge_blocks = 0;
00785 
00786   /* Check if the block will fit in the current block. */
00787   if (((*array)->first_index <= index) && \
00788       ((*array)->first_index + (*array)->length) >= (index + length))
00789     {
00790       return;
00791     }
00792   else
00793     {
00794       temp = *array;
00795 
00796       /* Find the block where the first element should be found. */
00797       if (temp->first_index + temp->length <= index)
00798         while ((temp->first_index + temp->length <= index) && temp->next)
00799           temp = temp->next;
00800       else
00801         while (temp->prev && \
00802                (temp->prev->first_index + temp->prev->length > index))
00803           temp = temp->prev;
00804     }
00805 
00806   if (temp->first_index <= index && (temp->first_index + temp->length > index))
00807     {
00808       if ((temp->first_index + temp->length) >= (index + length))
00809         {
00810           /* The requested block fits in this block. */
00811           *array = temp;
00812           return;
00813         }
00814       else
00815         {
00816           /* The requested block extends past this block. */
00817           MergeBlocks (array, index, length);
00818           return;
00819         }
00820     }
00821   else if (temp->first_index > index)
00822     {
00823       /* Need new block before temp. */
00824       if (temp->first_index < index + length)
00825         {
00826           /* The requested block extends into the next existing block. */
00827           merge_blocks = 1;
00828         }
00829 
00830       next = temp;
00831       prev = temp->prev;
00832     }
00833   else if ((temp->first_index + temp->length) <= index && temp->next == NULL)
00834     {
00835       /* Need new block after temp. */
00836       /* Note that this will also catch a new, empty BlockSparseArray
00837        * structure (first_index=0, length=0).  In that case, we don't add a
00838        * new node or merge.  We just initialize the empty structure below. */
00839       if (temp->length == 0)
00840         {
00841           initialize_struct_only = 1;
00842         }
00843       else
00844         {
00845           next = temp->next;
00846           prev = temp;
00847         }
00848     }
00849   else
00850     {
00851       I_punt ("block_sparse_array.c:GetOrAddBlock:%d Cannot find block for index %d", __LINE__);
00852     }
00853 
00854   /* If this block is adjacent to the previous or next blocks, merge the
00855    * blocks. */
00856   if (prev && (prev->first_index + prev->length == BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (index)))
00857     {
00858       length = prev->length + BSA_BLOCK_LENGTH (index, length);
00859       index = prev->first_index;
00860       merge_blocks = 1;
00861     }
00862   if (next && (next->first_index == \
00863                BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (index) + BSA_BLOCK_LENGTH (index, length)))
00864     {
00865       length = BSA_BLOCK_LENGTH (index, length) + next->length;
00866       index = BSA_BLOCK_INDEX (index);
00867       merge_blocks = 1;
00868     }
00869 
00870   /* If we're doing any merging, MergeBlocks will take care of the
00871    * initialization. */
00872   if (merge_blocks)
00873     {
00874       MergeBlocks (array, index, length);
00875       return;
00876     }
00877 
00878   if (initialize_struct_only == 0)
00879     {
00880       new = NewBlockSparseArray ();
00881 
00882       /* Copy the options field from array. */
00883       if (*array)
00884         new->options = (*array)->options;
00885     }
00886   else
00887     {
00888       /* Empty block. */
00889       new = temp;
00890     }
00891 
00892   /* Allocates a new data block and sets new's first_index and length
00893    * fields appropriately. */
00894   AllocateData (new, index, length);
00895 
00896   if (initialize_struct_only == 0)
00897     {
00898       new->next = next;
00899       new->prev = prev;
00900 
00901       if (prev)
00902         prev->next = new;
00903       if (next)
00904         next->prev = new;
00905     }
00906 
00907   *array = new;
00908   return;
00909 }
